Package org.knime.core.ui.node.workflow.lazy

Interface LazyWorkflowManagerUI

All Superinterfaces:
EventListener, org.knime.core.node.workflow.NodeContainerStateObservable, NodeContainerUI, org.knime.core.node.workflow.NodeProgressListener, UI, WorkflowManagerUI
public interface LazyWorkflowManagerUI extends WorkflowManagerUI
A workflow manager that isn't complete on instantiation and requires to (down-)load data (only once) before all methods can be used. If a method is called without loading (load()) the workflow manager first, a NotLoadedException will be thrown. Methods derived from the parent interface NodeContainerUI can be called without loading! The actual use case: (Wrapped) metanodes in a workflow (that are WorkflowManagerUI-instances themselves) usually are not loaded entirely - i.e. the node's data (name, ports etc.) is available but not the workflow they contain. When a method is called that accesses information of the contained workflow (e.g. contained nodes etc.), it needs to be loaded first by calling load().
Author:
Martin Horn, KNIME GmbH, Konstanz, Germany

  • Method Details

    • isLoaded

      boolean isLoaded()
      Returns:
      true if load() has been called at least once with success, otherwise false

    • load

      CompletableFuture<Void> load()
      (Down-)loads the data necessary to be able to call all methods of the workflow manager. If this method returns successfully, the workflow manager methods don't fail with a NotLoadedException anymore.
      Returns:
      the future that carries out the loading
